content.description: Sit start with your choice of edge. From there, negotiate the features to reach the arete and generous platform, match on a great undercling, gain the edge at the lip, and pull on top.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Solar System.

content.description: Sit start with your choice of edge. From there, pull up and bump through a pair of right hand sidepulls, then work up through the edges on the face with the left hand, and continue up the remaining slab for an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. There is a cactus that share the landing, otherwise it's very good.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Solar System

content.description: Sit start with a pair of edges. From there, place a right heel hook, make a big move to an edge-sidepull, reach the excellent diagonal edge with the left hand, then negotiate the remaining edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is great, but there is a rock just to the left of where the problem climbs.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Solar System.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the arete and a foot pasted. From there, make a few bunched moves on the arete, gain the great foot, reach a sidepull on the face, bump it to the edge, work the remaining arete to the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but there is a rock just left of where it climbs.
content.location: It climbs the north side of Solar System's northeast arete.

content.description:
Stand start with a thin right hand edge and a left hand gaston. From there, traverse right to a pair of edges, then head straight up for an easy mantel.

The movement on this one is quite fun, but I had to reduce the rating as the feet may not last.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. There is a rock that creates an uneven landing.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Solar System.

content.description: Sit start with your choice of hold. From there, climb straight through an assortment of holds on the vertical hueco features to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will work well. The landing is outstanding.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Solar System.

content.description: Sit start with your choice of hold. From there, climb straight up through a pair of huge huecos to a pair of edges on the slab and an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will work well. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Solar System.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand edge and a right hand undercling. From there, gain a pair of edges above, set your feet, make a deadpoint to the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is perfect though.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Solar System.

content.description:
Sit start with your choice of hold. From there, pull up to the big hueco, then use the teardrop to gain the lip and an easy mantel.

Also this can be a downclimb.
content.protection: A pad will work fine. It has a great landing.
content.location: It climbs the center of Solar System's east face.
